title: The 'selfish waster' who now runs a monastery
description: How a rebellious young man from Tibet ended up as abbot of a Buddhist centre in southern Scotland.

title: Eusebio Leal: The man who saved Old Havana from decay
description: Historian Eusebio Leal died last month but his legacy is far-reaching in the city he loved.

title: Caged Congolese teen: Why a zoo took 114 years to apologise
description: Ota Benga was kidnapped from what is now DR Congo in 1904 and taken to the US to be exhibited.

title: Adult industry workers surviving the pandemic
description: Sex industry workers from Taiwan, Argentina and India share their struggles because of Covid restrictions.

title: Rising Phoenix: Paralympics documentary 'will make you angry and upset'
description: New documentary Rising Phoenix focuses on the history and impact of the Paralympic Games.

description: When coral bleaching was suspected in a pristine reef, scientists turned to some unlikely surveyors.

title: Warning over 'dangerous' DIY beauty trends on TikTok
description: Teenagers have posted videos of supposed teeth-whitening, lip-plumping and mole-removal tips.

title: Why have there been so many U-turns recently?
description: There is some disquiet among Tory MPs - but there is evidence the public views a change of direction with sympathy.

title: Maguire's lack of apology 'shocking' but he still has time 'to say sorry' - prosecution lawyer

title: Coronavirus: Face coverings U-turn for England’s secondary schools
description: Pupils must wear masks in corridors in local lockdown areas after the government reversed its guidance.

title: BMW Mini Oxford car plant set for hundreds of job losses
description: The number of shifts are to be reduced because of a "substantial" fall in customer demand.

title: First Scottish deaths after test for six weeks
description: There had been no new deaths following a positive test reported in Scotland since 16 July.

title: Jacob Blake: Two shot dead in third night of Wisconsin unrest
description: The clashes in the city of Kenosha follow the police shooting of black man Jacob Blake.

title: Baby names: Dua Lipa and Kylo Ren inspire parents' choices
description: Baby girls called Dua doubled since she first hit number one and Kylo Ren is inspiring boys' names.

title: Storm Francis: Dozens evacuated after flooding

title: Coronavirus: Bereaved families call for meeting with Boris Johnson
description: The group warns of legal action unless the government orders an inquiry into its pandemic handling.

title: Coronavirus: Crime in England and Wales falls during lockdown
description: A fall in theft offences saw crime drop by a third, the ONS says, but drug offences rose 44%.

title: Did Messi really send his Barcelona transfer request by fax?
description: A short history of fax, why Messi had to use Spain's burofax system and some more fax facts.

title: Girls Aloud singer Sarah Harding diagnosed with breast cancer

description: The chance find was made on an isle where scientists have been hunting for the fossils for 200 years.

title: No plan for a return to the office for millions of staff

description: The prospect of a "really, really exciting" find will be checked by the Natural History Museum, experts say.

description: Jamaica's eight-time Olympic gold medallist Usain Bolt tests positive for coronavirus, his agent confirms.

description: DJ and broadcaster Jamz Supernova looks at what impact the pandemic has had on the clubbing industry.

description: No one believed pilot Amol Yadav when he told them his plans, but he proved them wrong.
